title: How to Make a Moist and Light Chocolate Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC or 350ºF or  Gas Mark 4.
steps.description: Line the baking tin/pan with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Beat the egg whites until stiff.
Put the oil and sugar in a clean bowl.
steps.description: Beat until they look like breadcrumbs.

steps.headline: Beat the egg yolks until light and fluffy.
Sift the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
Put the previously beaten yolks into the oil and sugar mixture.
steps.description: Mix together until the mixture is smooth.

steps.headline: Add the egg whites in a bit at a time.
steps.description: Gently fold them into the mixture using a knife or spatula. When folding the egg whites into the mixture, be careful not to over beat as the cake will become heavy.

steps.headline: Add the sifted dry mix in 3 to 4 additions.
Pour the batter in the pre-lined baking pan.
Tap the pan on the counter to get rid of excessive air pockets.
Bake in the oven for 28 minutes.
steps.description: Check with a toothpick or skewer that the cake is cooked before removing it.

steps.headline: Take the cake out of the baking pan.
steps.description: Place on a wire rack to let it cool to room temperature. Once cooled, it is ready to serve.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC or 350ºF or  Gas Mark 4. Line the baking tin/pan with parchment paper. Beat the egg whites until stiff.  Put the oil and sugar in a clean bowl. Beat until they look like breadcrumbs. Beat the egg yolks until light and fluffy.  Sift the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Mix them together. Put the previously beaten yolks into the oil and sugar mixture. Mix together until the mixture is smooth. Add the egg whites in a bit at a time. Gently fold them into the mixture using a knife or spatula. When folding the egg whites into the mixture, be careful not to over beat as the cake will become heavy. Add the sifted dry mix in 3 to 4 additions. Fold these ingredients in gently. Pour the batter in the pre-lined baking pan.  Tap the pan on the counter to get rid of excessive air pockets.  Bake in the oven for 28 minutes. Check with a toothpick or skewer that the cake is cooked before removing it. Take the cake out of the baking pan. Place on a wire rack to let it cool to room temperature. Once cooled, it is ready to serve.
